Happy Birthday Dr. Maria Montessori! Let‚Äôs do a ‚Äúwalk around the sun‚Äù in celebration. August 31, 2020 marks Montessori‚Äôs 150th birthday. Educators and Families around the world are celebrating her legacy.
.
Maria Montessori was an Italian physician, educator, and innovator, acclaimed for her educational method that builds on the way children learn naturally. She opened the first Montessori school‚Äîthe Casa dei Bambini, or Children's House‚Äîin Rome on January 6, 1907.
.
Montessori developed the Montessori Method of teaching based on observations she made of children in her own childcare center. The Montessori Method is based on the idea that children learn best when the environment supports their natural desire to acquire skills and knowledge.
.
We at Lee Montessori implement high-fidelity Montessori (as a tool) in a community that is racially and socioeconomically diverse, with the end goal of empowering each child we serve to be empowered to transform society.

#leemontessori #weheartmontessori #montessorieverywhere #montessori150

post_text: What is Practical Life? Practical Life are the activities of everyday life and they are involved in all aspects of life. The child observes these activities in the environment and gains knowledge through the real experience of how to accomplish life skills in a purposeful way. These activities are cultural and specific to the child's time and place. Practical life activities help give the child a sense of being and belonging, established through participation in daily life with us. Through practical life the child learns about his culture and all about what it is to be human. Generally the activities of practical life revolve around four areas: Caring for the Self, Caring for the Environment, Grace & Courtesy and Movement of Objects. #leemontessori #montessorimondays

Today we honor Tahiira Lee in honor of Black History Month.

Tahiira Lee, Montessori Guide
Lee Montessori was named after one of the kindest, most talented, and committed Montessori teachers to ever walk the earth. Tahiira Lee was born and raised in Washington, DC and attended Dunbar Senior High School. She went to undergraduate school in Oklahoma and continued her education at UDC, Trinity and Loyola University, where she earned her Montessori diploma.

Tahiira Lee, Montessori Evangelist
Beyond her work in the classroom, Ms. Lee recognized the need to promote Montessori in Washington, DC, especially in low-income communities and to students of color. As a result, not only did she inspire generations of students, but also a number of professionals whom she either introduced to Montessori or helped flame the fires of their passion for the work that we do. Several of these people were instrumental to the founding of Lee Montessori Public Charter School. #leemontessori #blackhistorymonth2020 #tahiiralee

post_text: Fall is here, and our Upper Elementary students are set on making sure our school has the most vibrant autumn colors for years to come! This week, 16 students took part in planting nine new trees on our campus. We planted native varieties including honey locust, maple, and paw paw. We'd like to extend a huge thank you to Casey Trees for partnering with us in their mission to help restore and enhance the tree canopy in Washington DC.
